Posts.Content: On 1/19/2008 annab519 wrote:   On 1/16/2008 Sharpies1978 wrote: Hello,  I'm wondering if anyone can offer me some ideas on a gift for my mom. She will be having surgery (radical mastectomy) on Friday. I'd like to get her an extra special get-well gift. I was thinking of something that will help her through this time but I don't want it to be strictly about the cancer...I'm sure she thinks of it enough. Any ideas?  Steph  Steph, When my mom had her radical mastectomy 5 yrs ago, I got matching pyjamas for her, my sister and me and after her surgery, my sister and I went to visit her in the hospital and we all put on our pj's and slippers, and turned it into a slumber party kind of thing.  It really lifted her spirits and we were all able to focus on just visiting and having a "girl party" right there in the hospital room.  Her doctor and nurses also thought it was a great idea and they got a kick out of all of us being in the same outfit.   If you are going to be there when she has the surgery, you might think along these lines... doesn't have to be an outfit... you can bring in some of her favorite pictures or things from home and decorate her hospital room to make it feel more "homey" while she recovers.  Having been a 2-time cancer survivor myself, I know that those kinds of creative touches that aren't really big or significant usually make patients feel like they are still "who they are" and not just their cancer.... Hope that helps.  Anna
